page.title: 01A GENERAL VIEW
page.content: The Catfield and Sutton Block is an area of flat arable farmland sloping gently from east to west.The fields and dykes drain into Barton Broad and the reed covered Sutton Broad. The River Ant flows southwards through Barton towards the Bure.In winter the landscape can appear bleak, but in summer the whole area is carpeted in green beneath wide blue Norfolk skies.The area is sparsely populated with most inhabitants living in the villages of Sutton and Catfield. Most of the houses in Sutton are built alongside the Old Yarmouth Road. Buildings in Catfield are grouped around the Post Office and public house. Both villages have been by passed by the re-routing of the A149 which now follows the course of the old M.G.N.J. Railway.
